c74object.name: bach.submatrix
c74object.digest: Get a submatrix of a matrix
c74object.description: Trims and outputs a rectangular portion of a matrix.

objarg.name: startrow
objarg.description: Set the starting row for trimming.

objarg.name: startcolumn
objarg.description: Set the starting column for trimming.

objarg.name: endrow
objarg.description: Set the ending row for trimming.

objarg.name: endcolumn
objarg.description: Set the ending column for trimming.

method.name: int
method.description:
The action depends on the inlet:
- in the second inlet: Sets the starting row for trimming
- in the third inlet: Sets the starting column for trimming
- in the fourth inlet: Sets the ending row for trimming
- in the fifth inlet: Sets the ending column for trimming

method.name: list
method.digest: Set all the boundaries at once
method.description: In the second inlet, a list of four integer numbers sets all the resize boundaries at once. Also see the int message.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Set original matrix and output submatrix
method.description:
The original matrix is trimmed and the result is output.
In the bach environment, a matrix is just a llll having depth two, whose first-level sublllls are the rows of the matrix. For instance the matrix (1 0 0) (0 1 0) (0 0 1) is the 3 by 3 identity matrix. A "good" matrix is supposed to be well formed, i.e. all its rows must have the same length. A matrix is square if the length of the rows (which is the number of columns) is the same as the number of rows.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

A matrix is square if the length of the rows (which is the number of columns) is the same as the number of rows.
